meanings.sent1: The sun can outshine the moon.
meanings.sent2: Her smile always seems to outshine the rest.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight tried to outshine the stars, but they just laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for singing can outshine even the brightest star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The diamond's sparkle can outshine any other gemstone.

meanings.definition: To surpass in excellence or beauty.
meanings.sent1: His kindness will outshine any material possession.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the sunset can outshine any painting.
meanings.sent3: The little flower tried to outshine the big roses, but they all ended up laughing together.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence outshines all others in the class.
meanings.sent5: The love in her heart can outshine any darkness.

meanings.sent1: The new LED light bulb can outshine the old incandescent one.
meanings.sent2: Her enthusiasm for the project outshines everyone else's.
meanings.sent3: The firefly thought it could outshine the streetlamp, but it was just a tiny glow.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed outshines any obstacle in his way.
meanings.sent5: The full moon can outshine the stars on a clear night.
